sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (Dragonborn are typically tall and solidly built, with most standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds)

entries.name: Age
entries: Young Dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. Dragonborn live to be about 80.

feat.name: Blood Hound
entries: Your senses are heightened beyond those of most folk. Whether these senses were strengthened through training or the loss of other senses, or they simply matured as you did, you are a master of finding those whom you seek. You  gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Motion Sensor
entries: Whenever a creature that is Small or larger moves within 10 feet of you while you do not have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, you immediately become aware of its presence.

entries.name: No Hiding
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sound or smell.

feat.name: Convincing Inquisitor
entries: You know how to spot a liar, and you can get people to see your way, whether through charm, reasonable arguments, or force of will. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Charming Presence
entries: When you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, you don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on checks to influence {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creatures, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on checks to influence {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} creatures.

entries.name: Multiple Paths
entries: You can use any ability modifier when you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action to make an {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or  {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} check.

entries.name: Zealous Insight
entries: When you succeed on a {@action Search|XPHB} action's Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check to detect lies or evasive answers, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls involving combat against that creature for 1 hour.

feat.name: Deathbound
entries: You have seen death many times, up close and personal, and sometimes at your own hand. These experiences have affected you deeply, teaching you about life and death. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: One Last Breath
entries: If you have two {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failures, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Death Saving Throws until you are no longer at 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Recuperation
entries: When you spend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} to recover {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} twice and use the higher roll.

feat.name: Fortune of the Thaumaturge
entries: Your connection to the Thaumaturge puts you in touch with forces outside mortal understanding, making others think you were born under a fortunate moon. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fortune's Fortitude
entries: When you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can expend and roll one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}, adding that number to your result. You can do this only once per {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.
You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all uses of this ability when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fortune of the Unknown
entries: When using the Fortune's Fortitude benefit, if you roll the highest or lowest number on the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}, you regain that {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}. It still counts as a use of Fortune's Fortitude.

feat.name: Free Sword Mercenary's Will
entries: Your training with the Company of Free Swords has given you an increased stamina and an attitude that make you less likely to succumb to hardships. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hold the Ground
entries: When you are moved without using your movement by a creature, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the distance you are moved by up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Resolute
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws that would apply a condition.

feat.name: Insightful Collector
entries: Your expeditions, transactions, and mercantile activities on behalf of the Augustine Trading Company have put you in contact with collectors of historical artifacts, relics, and tomes. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Object Intuition
entries: You can take a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine one magical object and learn its properties and how to use it without attuning to it or taking a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} in physical contact with it, but you don't learn any curse the item might bear. There is a cumulative 5% chance for every rarity above Common that you misidentify the nature and the power of the object.

entries.name: Rare Find
entries: You begin play in possession of a Common magic item. Work with your GM to decide on which object fits your character and the campaign.

feat.name: Resolution of the Syndicate
entries: Membership in the Ebon Syndicate provides perks—one of which is the motivation that comes with the understanding that the Syndicate kills those who fail too often. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Quick Strike
entries: On your first turn after an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll, add {@dice 1d4} to the first damage roll you make. This extra damage increases to {@dice 2d4} at character level 9, and to {@dice 4d4} at character level 16.

entries.name: Resilient
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an amount equal to your character level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a character level thereafter, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an additional 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

feat.name: Survivor
entries: Your ability to make the best out of a bad situation has served you well. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hardy
entries: You need half the amount of food per day based on your size.

entries.name: Intuitive
entries: When you take the {@action Study|XPHB} action, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence checks made when taking the {@action Study|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Shake It Off
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, decreases by 1. Additionally, when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level decreases by 2.

feat.name: Triage Expert
entries: You are trained in dealing with injuries on the battlefield, and with the saving of lives afterward. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bedside Manner
entries: Whenever you cause a creature to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or the Blood and Bone benefit, you can roll one extra die and discard the lowest die.

entries.name: Blood and Bone
entries: Taking the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action and expending the use of a {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB} lets you heal a creature within 5 feet of you. The creature can expend and roll a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} and regain that number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

feat.name: Blackpowder Pistol Expert
entries: You have become practiced with the use of Blackpowder Pistols. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Deadeye
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with a Blackpowder Pistol.

entries.name: Quick Load
entries: You ignore {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading} of the Blackpowder Pistol.

entries.name: Trick Shot
entries: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you moves, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a ranged attack with a Blackpowder Pistol against that creature.

feat.name: Expanded Grip
entries: Your natural ability with larger weapons lets you use them in a way others can't. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: One-Handed Grip
entries: When you use a Versatile weapon with one hand, the weapon deals the damage in parentheses when used to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Zealous Grasp
entries: If an effect forces you to drop what you are holding, you can make a DC 15 Strength saving throw to maintain your grip. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to maintain your grip, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

feat.name: Hulking Figure
entries: Either from extensive training or a natural build, you have a broad and formidable size for your species. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Brutal
entries: Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d4} Bludgeoning damage to a target you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Intimidating
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check, you can also add your Strength modifier to the roll.

entries.name: Powerful
entries: You count as one size larger (to a maximum size of Large) when determining your carrying capacity.

feat.name: Iron Gut
entries: You can eat like a hill giant and drink like a fish. Years of punishing your stomach and liver have led to a powerful fortitude. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inured to Poison
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Everything Looks Delicious
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks to forage for food.

entries.name: Quick to Recover
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, roll the die and add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Lightning Caster
entries: Your rapid-fire style of casting cantrips allows you to weave magic with uncanny speed. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dual Target
entries: When you cast a cantrip with a casting time of an action that targets a single creature, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to target a second creature within the cantrip's range.

entries.name: Immediate Response
entries: When you cast a spell as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, that spell doesn't expend a spell slot. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Medician of the Morbus Doctore
entries: You are a master of the medical sciences because of your association with a medical institute. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Adept Medic
entries: When you use the Blood and Bone benefit of the Triage Expert feat, the creature can spend up to three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} instead of one.

entries.name: Battle Surgeon
entries: When you use the Blood and Bone benefit of the Triage Expert feat, the creature can spend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to end one of the following conditions on itself instead of regaining {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.
Alternatively, you can cure one Grievous Wound affecting the creature (see Grim Hollow {@variantrule Campaign|XPHB} Guide).

feat.name: Nimble Physique
entries: You are small and thin for your species. You have a mysterious and consistent ability to avoid danger. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Dodgy
entries: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Slippery
entries: While you are {@condition Grappled|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, your attacks don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} and attacks against you don't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

feat.name: Sangromantic Initiate
entries: You have become adept enough with weaving blood magic to mitigate some of the harm of Sangromancy. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blood Magic
entries: Choose a Sangromancy spell from any spell list of a level for which you have spell slots. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slot you have.

entries.name: Sanguine Potency
entries: You have a pool of two d12s that you can expend instead of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} when you cast Sangromancy spells. Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Shadowsteel Adept
entries: You have learned to tap into the dangerous but powerful art of Shadowsteel casting. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Curse Caster
entries: You always have Shadowsteel curses prepared, and you can cast them with any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Shadowsteel's Bite
entries: While holding your Shadowsteel Focus, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.

entries.name: Shadowsteel Weapon
entries: If your Shadowsteel Focus is also a weapon, that weapon has a +1 bonus to weapon attack rolls and damage rolls.

feat.name: Shadowsteel Master
entries: Your mastery over Shadowsteel grows stronger. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Necrotic Harmony
entries: While holding your Shadowsteel Focus, when you cast a spell that targets one or more creatures and requires an attack roll or saving throw, you can choose one target you hit or who failed the saving throw to also take {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage for each spell slot level expended to cast the spell.

entries.name: Necrotic Weapon
entries: If your Shadowsteel Focus is also a weapon, that weapon has a +2 bonus to weapon attack rolls and damage rolls. Additionally, once on each of your turns, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack roll using your Shadowsteel Focus, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 2d8} Necrotic damage.

feat.name: Syndicate Spy
entries: Rising in the ranks of the Ebon Syndicate has taught you the clandestine skills of spycraft, valuable in your trade as a racketeer. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Locksmith
entries: You have proficiency with {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}. While holding {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, you can craft a key to a lock by spending 10 minutes with that lock.

entries.name: Master of Disguise
entries: You have proficiency with a {@item Disguise Kit|XPHB}. If you spend 10 minutes donning a {@item Costume|XPHB},  you decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your statistics change. You can't appear as a creature of a different size, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this benefit to become quadrupedal, for instance.

entries.name: Master Calligrapher
entries: You have proficiency with a {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}. You aren't limited to 10 or fewer words when mimicking someone else's handwriting.

entries.name: Blending In
entries: When using the {@action Hide|XPHB} action to conceal yourself from creatures that aren't {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you, you need only be {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} and you may use Charisma instead of Dexterity for the check.

feat.name: Thrown Weapon Master
entries: You excel at thrown weapons. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Multithrow
entries: After you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to make a ranged attack roll using a Simple weapon that has {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown}, you can make two additional ranged attacks using Simple weapons that have {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Quick Hands
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can retrieve and stow or wield all Simple weapons with {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} that are within 5 feet of you. You need a free hand to perform this maneuver.

entries.name: Returning
entries: Simple weapons with {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} that you are proficient with also have the Returning property (see Chapter 8: Advanced Weapons & Equipment).

feat.name: Witch Hunter
entries: You have honed and perfected your skills fighting against spellcasters, possibly from your background hunting mages as part of the Arcanist Inquisition. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dodge Spells
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to avoid a spell that is targeting only you and doesn't create an area of effect. Make a Wisdom saving throw against the spellcaster's spell save DC. On a successful save, the creature must choose a new target or the spell is canceled. A canceled spell dissipates with no effect, and any resources used to cast it are wasted.

entries.name: Keep Your Enemies Close
entries: When you hit a target that can cast spells with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can reduce its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} by 15 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Resist Curses
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against all Shadowsteel curses, and also against spells with a duration of more than 10 minutes.

feat.name: Advanced Weapon Proficiency
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Weapon Proficiency
entries: You have proficiency with Advanced weapons, and your training allows you to use the mastery properties of those weapons.

entries.name: Special
entries: This feat can be taken as a General feat by a character of level 8 or higher.

feat.name: Close Combat Artillerist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Firing in Melee
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

entries.name: Point Blank
entries: When you hit a creature that is within 5 feet of you with a ranged attack, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

feat.name: Dual Shot
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dual Shot
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and attack with a bow or crossbow, you can make one extra attack as part of the same action against a creature that is within 10 feet of the original target that is within the weapon's range. If you do so, both attacks are made with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

feat.name: Flurry
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Quick Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make an attack roll with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll, you can forgo {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on that attack roll. After resolving that attack, you can then make another attack with the same weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against a different creature. The new target must be within 5 feet of the first target and within the weapon's reach.

feat.name: Mobile Combatant
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Slippery
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you until the end of your turn.

feat.name: Opportunist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Exploit Weakness
entries: Whenever you make an attack as part of a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack and damage rolls.

feat.name: Prone Defense
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Defensive
entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls. {@action Attack|XPHB} roll against you doesn't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} because of the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Hop Up
entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can right yourself with only 5 feet of movement.

feat.name: Boon of the Archlich
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Vessel of Vitality
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, if your Soul Vessel is not charged, it gains a soul and becomes charged.

feat.name: Boon of the Ascended Vampire
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inured to Sunlight
entries: You are no longer affected by sunlight.

feat.name: Boon of the Earthly Tether
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Persistent Haunter
entries: You are no longer affected by the Fraying Reality Transformation Flaw.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Specter Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elder Horror
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Stabilizing Form
entries: When you roll a 25 or lower on the Unstable Form table, you can choose to roll again. You must use the new result. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Aberrant Horror Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elder Fey
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fey Bulwark
entries: You are no longer affected by the Weakened Constitution Transformation Flaw.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Fey Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

entries.name: Free Agent
entries: You are no longer affected by the Pull of The Netherworld Transformation Flaw.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Fiend Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of the Elemental Temperance
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Controlled Chaos
entries: You are no longer affected by the Primordial Chaos Transformation Flaw.

feat.name: Boon of the High Seraph
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Absolution
entries: You are no longer affected by the Seraph Corruption Transformation Flaw.

entries.name: Divergent Growth
entries: Choose any Seraph Transformation Boon that you don't already have but meet the prerequisites for. You gain that Boon.

feat.name: Boon of Magic Resistance
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heroic Resistance
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can cause yourself to succeed instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Boon of Perfect Flight
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Flying
entries: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 40 feet and can hover. Graceful Fall. If you fall more than 5 feet, your rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until you land.

feat.name: Boon of Shadowsteel Mastery
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Strange Bedfellows
entries: You are no longer affected by the Friendless Transformation Flaw.

feat.name: Boon of the Wilds
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Apex Predator
entries: When you enter your Hybrid Form, you gain 25 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. At the end of each of your turns while in Hybrid Form, if you have no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. While you are in your Hybrid Form and have no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls.

entries.name: Armor-Piercing
entries: An Armor-Piercing weapon is a Melee weapon designed to punch through armor or thick hide. When you make an attack roll using an Armor-Piercing weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack roll if your target is wearing armor or has an {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} of 18 or higher.

entries.name: Blackpowder
entries: Blackpowder weapons fire projectiles with ear-splitting noise, shredding armor with deadly force. When fired, Blackpowder weapons emit a deafening crack audible 300 feet away. A Blackpowder weapon exposed to heavy rain, submerged, or similarly drenched in water, can't fire until dried for 1 hour. These weapons use paper cartridge bullets as ammunition.

entries.name: Cumbersome
entries: Cumbersome weapons are difficult to wield but are effective ranged tools for those strong enough to wield them. When making an attack with a Cumbersome weapon, you must use your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Damage
entries: A {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} property weapon can deal different types of damage. When you hit with an attack from this weapon, choose one of the damage types allowed.

entries.name: Double
entries: A Double weapon functions as two Light weapons, one in each hand, for the purposes of two-weapon fighting. If a Double weapon has {@itemProperty R|XPHB|Reach}, you can use only one of these properties per turn.

entries.name: Hafted
entries: A Hafted weapon's haft can function well as an off-hand attack. After you use the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to attack with a Hafted weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make a melee attack with the haft. The haft deals {@damage 1d6} Bludgeoning damage, and you add your ability modifier to damage.

entries.name: Magazine
entries: A weapon with the Magazine property also has a number and an ammunition type. The weapon holds that amount and type of ammunition, which you can expend before needing to reload the weapon. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you may remove a Magazine and then reload it with a new Magazine. A Magazine weapon comes with two empty magazines included in the weapon's cost and weight. An additional empty magazine for a Magazine weapon costs 25 GP. Loading an empty Magazine with ammunition takes 1 minute.

entries.name: Momentum
entries: Momentum weapons allow you to deliver devastating attacks as part of rapid movement. When you hit with a Momentum weapon after you moved 20 feet or more in a straight line during the same turn, upgrade the damage dice to the weapon's Momentum Dice value.

entries.name: Momentum
entries: Repeater weapons can fire ammo in quick succession, using multiple barrels or quick-reloading mechanisms. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action with a Repeater weapon, you can shoot multiple times if you have features that let you attack more than once as part of that action, such as Extra Attack. After taking the {@action Attack|XPHB} action you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to attack once with the same weapon. You don't add your ability modifier to the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}'s attack, unless that modifier is negative.

itemMastery.name: Brutal
entries: A Brutal weapon is designed for maximum damage. Brutal weapons score Critical Hits on a natural roll of 19 or 20. If your Critical Range is already increased, instead increase it by 1 point (such as from 19-20 to 18-20).
When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a Brutal weapon against a creature, the weapon deals one additional die of damage.

itemMastery.name: Defending
entries: A Defending weapon is either made for parrying, has advanced techniques for use in parrying, or both. When wielding a Defending weapon, you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are hit by a melee attack roll. Roll {@dice 1d4} and add the result to your AC, including against the triggering attack.

itemMastery.name: Disarming
entries: A Disarming weapon can catch a foe's weapon, allowing you to remove it from their grasp. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and hit with a Disarming weapon, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn to disarm the target. Both you and the attacker must make opposed attack rolls, ignoring any sources of {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}. If your result is higher and the weapon is something the target can drop, the weapon falls from the target's grasp, landing in its space.

If your winning result on the opposed attack roll was a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, you can choose for the weapon either to land in a space of your choice up to 15 feet from the target, or to land in your hand if you have a free hand.

itemMastery.name: Entangling
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and hit with an Entangling weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn to entangle the target. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 10 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition until it escapes or until you release the weapon. The target succeeds automatically if it is Huge or larger.

To escape, the target must use an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) check against the same DC. On a success, the target no longer has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. While a creature is {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by this weapon, you can't use it to attack a different creature.

itemMastery.name: Returning
entries: A Returning weapon allows you to hurl the weapon in such a way that it returns to you. When you make a ranged attack with a Returning weapon, the weapon returns to you immediately after hitting or missing the target. You can catch the weapon if you have a hand free to do so.

itemMastery.name: Scatter
entries: Scatter weapons can devastate multiple enemies at once. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and hit a creature with a Scatter weapon, measure the weapon's scatter range from the target's space (or one square the creature occupies if it is Large or larger). Creatures other than the original target that fall within the weapon's scatter range take damage equal to your 1 + your Dexterity modifier (minimum 2). This damage is of the same type you dealt to the original target.

itemMastery.name: Set
entries: Weapons with the Set property allow you to prepare for an oncoming attack. If a target enters your reach while you wield a weapon with this property, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack with the weapon against that target.

itemMastery.name: Strong-Draw
entries: A weapon with the Strong-Draw quality requires great strength to use. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls with a Strong-Draw weapon unless your Strength is 13 or higher. You add both your Strength and Dexterity modifiers to damage with a Strong-Draw weapon.

itemMastery.name: Swift
entries: Swift weapons help you recover quickly from missed attacks. When you miss with a Swift weapon, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack roll you make with the weapon against the same target before the end of your next turn. If that attack hits, it also deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the weapon's normal damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Amphibious
entries: Surviving underwater is second nature to you. You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Water Born
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks or saving throws made while submerged in water. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Animal Friend
entries: Time spent among beasts has gifted you a way with those creatures. You have proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Animal Ally
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Artificial Form
entries: You were made, not born, and your unnatural origin forever marks you as different. You are a Construct, but your enchanted form still benefits from healing spells. You can also heal yourself by spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} during Short Rests and Long Rests, as normal.
You don't need to eat, drink, sleep, or breathe. You must still be inactive for 8 hours during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} to gain its benefits.

entries.name: Self-Repair
entries: If you take this trait twice, when the {@spell Mending|XPHB} cantrip is cast on you, you can spend a Hit Die to regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll of the die plus your Constitution modifier (minimum 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}). You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Artisanal Focus
entries: You revere the crafting skill of ancestors long dead. Choose an Artisan's Tool. You have proficiency with that tool.

entries.name: Artisanal Expertise
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain proficiency with a new tool each time.

Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made using any tool you selected with Artisanal Focus. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Athlete's Spirit
entries: Your reserves of physical power have kept you alive on more than one occasion. You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Athlete's Resolve
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Athletics checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Awakened Mind
entries: The dangers of Etharis have given you a focus that allows you to shrug off debilitating magical effects. You automatically succeed on saving throws against magical effects that would give you the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, or {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} conditions. This does not include effects that leave you {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} because you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Reawakened
entries: If you take this trait twice, you also have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Awesome Critical
entries: When fortune favors your blade, you know how to make it count. When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a melee attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

entries.name: Maximum Critical
entries: If you take this trait twice, when you use Awesome Critical, you can add the maximum of the weapon's original damage dice and the extra Awesome Critical die to the extra damage of the {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, rather than rolling them. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Battlefield Control
entries: When foes attempt to press you in melee, they do so at their peril. Other creatures provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} from you whenever they move into your reach, in addition to when they move out of your reach.

entries.name: Battlefield Dominance
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Born Healer
entries: When others suffer, you are there to help. You have proficiency in the {@skill Medicine|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Combat Doctor
entries: If you take this trait twice, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Medicine checks. You can use this feature a number of times equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Brave
entries: The horrors you've lived through have hardened you. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid being {@condition Frightened|XPHB}.

entries.name: Infectious Bravery
entries: If you take this trait twice, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to bolster the spirits of your allies, granting one ally who can see or hear you {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on a saving throw against being {@condition Frightened|XPHB}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: A connection to draconic or elemental fury lets you unleash a blast of destructive energy. When you select this trait, choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. Then choose an area of effect: a {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} that is 5 feet wide and 30 feet long, or a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}.

When you use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to expel your Breath Weapon, each creature in the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). A target creature takes {@damage 1d8} damage of the chosen type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach character levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Potent Breath
entries: If you take this trait multiple times, you gain an additional breath weapon each time, with its own number of uses, damage type, and area of effect. Additionally, when you use any of your Breath Weapons, one target of your choice has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Burst of Speed
entries: The many things that want to kill you must catch you first. On your turn, you can increase your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} by 30 feet until the end of your turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Furious Speed
entries: If you take this trait twice, on a turn when you use Burst of {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, you don't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Befuddled
entries: {@b Cost:} 2 Jinx Points
As a Magic action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself that is cursed by your Evil Eye and spend 2 Jinx Points. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 10 minutes or until you or your allies damage it. When the effect ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Clumsy
entries: {@b Cost:} 3 Jinx Points

When a creature cursed by your Evil Eye moves at least 5 feet on its turn, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 3 Jinx Points to cause the creature to have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and have its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced to 0 until the end of its turn.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Debilitated
entries: {@b Cost:} 1 Jinx Point
When a creature cursed by your Evil Eye takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Jinx Point to roll {@dice 1d12}. The creature takes Necrotic damage equal to the roll.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Doomed
entries: {@b Cost:} 1 Jinx Point
When you miss with an attack roll against a creature cursed by your Evil Eye, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Jinx Point to reroll the attack. You must use the new roll.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Fearful
entries: {@b Cost:} 2 Jinx Points
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself that is cursed by your Evil Eye and spend 2 Jinx Points. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} target repeats the save, ending the Misfortune on itself on a success.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Inept
entries: {@b Cost:} 1 Jinx Point

After a creature you can see that is cursed by your Evil Eye makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Jinx Point to make the target reroll, and it must use the new roll.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Insensate
entries: {@b Cost:} 3 Jinx Points
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose a creature that you can see that is cursed by your Evil Eye and spend 3 Jinx Points. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} conditions for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the Misfortune on itself on a success.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Maimed
entries: {@b Cost:} 2 Jinx Points

When you hit a creature cursed by your Evil Eye with an attack roll using a weapon or Unarmed Strike and roll a 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 2 Jinx Points to score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Marked
entries: {@b Cost:} 2 Jinx Points

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 2 Jinx Points to increase the duration of your Evil Eye to 1 hour or until you mark a different creature with your Evil Eye, whichever comes first.
Additionally, while a creature is affected by this curse, you always know the direction and distance to the creature while the two of you are on the same plane of existence.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Plagued
entries: {@b Cost:} 1 Jinx Point

When a creature you can see that is cursed by your Evil Eye would regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Jinx Point to halve the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} regained. Afterward, the creature can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Somnolent
entries: {@b Cost:} 3 Jinx Points
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose a creature you can see that is cursed by your Evil Eye and spend 3 Jinx Points. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The condition ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the Misfortune's effect.
Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, or that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition automatically succeed on saves against this Misfortune.
After you use this Misfortune, the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Unlucky
entries: {@b Cost:} 3 Jinx Points

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 3 Jinx Points to put a pox on a creature cursed by your Evil Eye. Whenever the creature is about to make an attack roll or saving throw, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and subtract the number rolled from the total.
This Misfortune ends when the creature is no longer cursed by your Evil Eye.

optionalfeature.name: Barbarian
entries: You've learned to fight with primal ferocity.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while you aren't wearing Heavy armor, you can enter a rampage for 1 minute. During this time, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage, and you can't maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. Your rampage ends early if you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.
Once you use this talent, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Cleric
entries: You've gained the ability to channel divine energy directly from the gods, emboldening allies and sanctifying their attacks. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature within 30 feet of you. For 10 minutes, the target gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Bard level plus your Charisma modifier. While a creature has {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} grant- ed by this talent, it can choose to lose all remaining {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} when it hits a creature with an attack made with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, dealing extra Radiant damage equal to the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost.
Once you use this talent, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Druid
entries: You can cast the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell with this talent, you can target yourself only and the maximum {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} of the Beast you can transform into equals half your Druid level.
Once you cast the spell using this talent, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Fighter
entries: You gain proficiency with {@filter martial weapons|items|type=martial weapon} and training with {@item Shield|XPHB|Shields}. In addition, you gain a {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Monk
entries: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield|XPHB}, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Charisma modifiers. You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}, and you can roll {@dice 1d6} in place of the normal damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. In addition, after you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action or take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can make one attack with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Paladin
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend a spell slot to deal an extra {@dice 1d6} Radiant damage to the target, plus another {@dice 1d6} per level of the spell slot.
The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} if the target is a Fiend or an Undead.
Once you use this talent, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Ranger
entries: You always have the {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast this spell using a 5th-level spell slot without expending a spell slot.
Once you cast the spell using this talent, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Rogue
entries: You've adopted the quick thinking of heroes who have outsmarted their foes. On your turn, you can take one of the following actions as a {@action Bonus Action|XPHB}: {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Hide|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Sorcerer
entries: Choose one of the following Metamagic Options available to the Sorcerer class: {@optfeature Careful Spell|XPHB}, {@optfeature Distant Spell|XPHB}, {@optfeature Empowered Spell|XPHB}, {@optfeature Extended Spell|XPHB}, {@optfeature Seeking Spell|XPHB}, {@optfeature Subtle Spell|XPHB}, or {@optfeature Transmuted Spell|XPHB}.
When you cast a Bard spell, you can apply that Metamagic Option as if you had paid its Sorcery Point cost.
Once you use this talent, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Warlock
entries: You learn one {@filter Eldritch Invocation|optionalfeatures|feature type=EI} of your choice. If an invocation has a level requirement, use your Bard level.
When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the invocations you know and replace it with another invocation for which you qualify.

optionalfeature.name: Wizard
entries: You prepare any two spells from the {@filter Wizard spell list|spells|class=Wizard} that are of a level you can cast. These count as Bard spells for you but do not count against your number of Prepared Spells.
When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Wizard spells you have prepared and replace it with another spell from the Wizard spell list of a level you can cast.

{@i Choose A, B, or C:} (A) {@item Scale Mail|XPHB}, {@item Longsword|XPHB}, {@item Light Crossbow|XPHB}, 20 {@item Bolt|XPHB|Bolts}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 5 GP; (B) {@item Studded Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Scimitar|XPHB}, {@item Shortsword|XPHB}, {@item Longbow|XPHB}, 20 {@item Arrow|XPHB|Arrows}, {@item Quiver|XPHB}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 10 GP; or (C) 160 GP

classFeature.name: Monster Grimoire
entries: You create or inherit a repository of knowledge known as a Monster Grimoire. Each Monster Hunter carries a grimoire, a manual on dangerous creatures. A Monster Hunter's grimoire is an object entirely unique to each hunter. It may be a leather tome recovered from a dusty library with notes made in the margins, a set of blood-stained scrolls inherited from a previous hunter, or a precious stone with a communing spirit held within.

If a Monster Hunter ever loses a grimoire, the hunter has retained enough knowledge to not suffer immediate drawbacks. However, the hunter can't add to the grimoire until it is restored and therefore can't take another Monster Hunter level until a lost grimoire has been replaced. A grimoire can be recreated by spending 8 hours and 50 GP worth of materials such as books, scrolls, and ink.

Choose two types of creatures that you are specialized in hunting from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Celestials, Constructs, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead.

You add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to Intelligence and Wisdom checks you make that relate to the creature types in your grimoire. For example, if Undead are in your grimoire, you add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to an Intelligence ({@skill History|XPHB}) check to recall lore about an Undead creature you're investigating or a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check to identify claw marks left on a corpse by an Undead creature. If you are already proficient in a skill when asked to make an Intelligence or Wisdom ability check relating to the monster types in your grimoire, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} instead.
When you gain this feature, you also learn one language based on the chart below. (You can add languages to this chart based on your own campaign world.)

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as Longbows and Longswords. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.
When you reach certain Monster Hunter levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Monster Hunter Features table.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice.

classFeature.name: Studied Response
entries: You have learned the most effective way to slay a monster is to strike its most vulnerable area at the right moment. Too early, and your attack glances away. Too late, and the monster may eviscerate you.

When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you targets you or another creature with a melee or ranged attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} before the attack roll to make one attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against that creature.
If the attack misses, you regain the use of your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Monster Hunter Subclass
entries: You gain a Monster Hunter subclass of your choice. The Carver Guild, Devourer Guild, Occultist Guild, and Trapper Guild subclasses are detailed below. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Monster Hunter levels. The guild you choose grants you features when you reach Monster Hunter levels 3, 7, 10, 15, and 18.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Monster Hunter levels 8, 12, 16, and 19.

classFeature.name: Expert Strike
entries: You learn the weaknesses of monsters so that you know exactly where to strike to inflict the most damage. You can add your Intelligence modifier to the attack and damage rolls of your weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}.

classFeature.name: Improved Monster Grimoire
entries: You have expanded your Monster Grimoire with your experience and knowledge.

You can select a third creature type to add to your Monster Grimoire from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Celestials, Constructs, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead. You can't choose a creature type you have chosen before. All the benefits you gain from your Monster Grimoire now also apply to this new type.

Additionally, your attack rolls with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} against creature types in your Monster Grimoire can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Knowledgeable Defense
entries: You can rely on your knowledge to anticipate a monster's actions and summon your best defense.
Whenever a creature type in your Monster Grimoire forces you to make a saving throw, you can make an Intelligence saving throw in place of that saving throw instead.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Improved Monster Grimoire
entries: Your Monster Grimoire is further expanded by your encounters and studies.

You can select a fourth creature type to add to your Monster Grimoire from the following list: Aberrations, Beasts, Constructs, Celestials, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Oozes, Plants, or Undead. You can't choose a monster type you have chosen before. All the benefits you gain from your Monster Grimoire now also apply to this new monster type.

classFeature.name: Lair Sense
entries: You are experienced at navigating the threats that arise near a monster's lair. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage of lair actions and regional effects caused by creatures. In addition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to damage against the Legendary Actions of creature types in your Monster Grimoire.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Slayer's Aid
entries: You're able to coordinate with your allies to quickly slay dangerous monsters.

When you use Studied Response, choose a {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} creature that can see or hear you. That creature can use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against the creature that triggered your Studied Response. If the ally does not have their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, they regain it but then must use it to make the attack. Your ally's attack occurs after yours but before the target creature rolls its own attack. This ability refreshes at the start of your turn.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monster Hunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Grave Strike
entries: You gain the ability to strike mortal blows against the creatures you have studied.

Your attack rolls with weapons and Unarmed Strikes against creature types in your Monster Grimoire can now score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 18 through 20 on the {@dice d20}. When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against a creature type in your Monster Grimoire, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC equals the damage taken, up to a maximum DC of 30. On a failed save, the creature drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. On a successful save, the creature takes the attack's normal damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Monster Hunter
entries: Monster Hunters are skilled professionals, specializing in identifying, tracking, and slaying monsters that threaten the lives and the livelihoods of the people of Etharis.

Each Monster Hunter trains in a different method for these tasks. Some hunters don heavy armor and carry shields to protect against crushing jaws and scything claws, others deploy cunning traps to keep a safe distance from the horrors they hunt, some assume the traits and powers of their enemies to better slay them, and others dabble in magic to supplement martial prowess with arcane wrath.

subclass.name: Path of the Primal Spirit
subclassFeatures: Path of the Primal Spirit|Barbarian|XPHB|Primal Spirit|GrimHollowPG24|3

subclass.name: Path of the Wrathful Dead
subclassFeatures: Path of the Wrathful Dead|Barbarian|XPHB|Wrathful Dead|GrimHollowPG24|3
Death Is but a Door|Barbarian|XPHB|Wrathful Dead|GrimHollowPG24|10

subclass.name: Warrior of the Leaden Crown
subclassFeatures: Warrior of the Leaden Crown|Monk|XPHB|Leaden Crown|GrimHollowPG24|3

subclass.name: Eldritch Domain
subclassFeatures: Sing the Song that Ends the World|Cleric|XPHB|Eldritch|GrimHollowPG24|17

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Fractured
entries: {@i Two Personalities Are Better than One}

Barbarians are defined by their rage, channeling it to unleash brief but potent destruction. Few are brave or unwise enough to study esoteric psychological techniques that split their rage from the rest of their psyche, dividing their identity into two parts: ego and id. When their ego is in control, the Fractured—as these Barbarians are known—possess self-control and cunning beyond most other Barbarians. When they allow their id to take control, their countenance turns monstrous and their bodies swell with the power of rage made physically manifest.

subclassFeature.name: Face of Rage
entries: When you activate your Rage, your countenance distorts and your body swells. Creatures that haven't witnessed your transformation, now or previously, don't recognize you. In addition, while your Rage is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can roll {@dice 1d8} in place of the normal damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, and whenever you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can push it 10 feet or force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
You count as one size larger when determining the success or failure of a Grapple, and when you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, your reach is 5 feet greater than normal.

subclassFeature.name: Mask of Civility
entries: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Medicine|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}, or {@skill Religion|XPHB}. In addition, you gain proficiency with one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice or you know one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Brains and Brawn
entries: While your Rage is not active, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage. While your Rage is active, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to every damage type except Force and Psychic.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning and Brutal
entries: While your Rage is not active, you can take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} or {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. While your Rage is active, your attack rolls with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

subclassFeature.name: Better Half
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead, and you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. In addition, if your Rage is active, your Rage ends. If your Rage was not active, you immediately activate your Rage (even if you have no remaining uses of your Rage). If any of these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} remain after 1 minute, they vanish.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Primal Spirit
entries: {@i Rage Alongside a Bestial Spirit}

Many Barbarians are in tune with the natural world, but few are as mystically intertwined with it as those who walk the Path of the Primal Spirit. These Barbarians forge powerful connections with beasts and nature spirits, inspiring such ethereal beings to manifest and journey on far-flung adventures.

Barbarians who follow this path have a deep reverence for the cycle of the natural world. Such Barbarians are as likely to accept quests and pleas for aid from local wildlife as they are from people. This respect for animals and spirits doesn't cross into naivety—few understand the delicate balance between the needs of predator and prey better than those who walk the Path of the Primal Spirit.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Companion
entries: You magically summon a primal spirit that adopts the form of a beast and accompanies you on your adventures. Choose its stat block: {@creature Primal Guardian|GrimHollowPG24} or {@creature Primal Striker|GrimHollowPG24}. In addition, choose an environment that will modify the creature's stat block: Land, Sea, or Sky. You also determine the kind of animal it is, choosing a kind appropriate for the stat block. Whatever companion you choose, it bears eldritch markings indicating its otherworldly origin.
The companion is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your allies and obeys your commands. It vanishes if you die.

entries.name: The Beast in Combat
entries: In combat, the companion acts during your turn. It can move and use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on its own, but the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command it to take an action in its stat block or some other action. You can also sacrifice one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to command the beast to take the Beast's Strike action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the companion acts on its own and isn't limited to the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Restoring or Replacing the Beast
entries: If the companion has died within the last hour, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch it and expend a use of your Rage. The companion returns to life immediately with all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can summon a different primal companion, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. You choose its stat block and appearance. If you already have a beast from this feature, the old one vanishes when the new one appears.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Rage
entries: While your Rage is active, your primal companion has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Kin to Beasts
entries: You always have the {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB} and {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} spells prepared. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for them.

subclassFeature.name: Skinrider's Trance
entries: You take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to enter a trance and choose your primal companion or one Beast currently under the effect of your {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB} spell within 60 feet of yourself. For the duration of this trance, you possess the chosen creature.

Once you possess a creature's body, you control it. Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and senses are replaced by the creature's. You otherwise keep your game statistics. This possession ends if you choose to exit the trance (no action required by you), if the Beast you're possessing is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or if you and the Beast are on different planes of existence.

While in this trance, your body falls into a catatonic state. You can't move or take Reactions, and you're unaware of your surroundings. You can remain in the trance for a number of hours up to half your Barbarian level plus your Constitution modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending one use of your Rage (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Shape of the Wild
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose a new form for your primal companion, causing it to transform instantaneously. When you cause your primal companion to transform in this way, its current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} change to its new {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending one use of your Rage (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Wrathful Dead
entries: {@i Channel the Rage of the Unquiet Dead}

Barbarians who walk the Path of the Wrathful Dead commune with the spirits of the deceased and channel their spectral powers. These Barbarians are often preoccupied with the dead whispering in their ears, which urge them to act upon the whims and emotions of the haunting spirits. Some who walk this path learn to master the powers gifted to them; others find they've become servants to the unending chorus clamoring for their attention.

subclassFeature.name: Rage of the Dead
entries: Your Rage taps into the endless fury of the unquiet dead. While your Rage is active, you take on aspects of restless spirits and you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shadow Form
entries: You ignore {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. In addition, you can move through the space of any creature, but you can't end your move in an occupied space.

entries.name: Shadowy Sidestep
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet, and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you.

entries.name: Spectral Sight
entries: You see creatures and objects within 120 feet that have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane.

subclassFeature.name: Final Night Catharsis
entries: You are overcome by an emotion a nearby spirit experienced at its death. You gain one of the following options of your choice. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your choice.

entries.name: Hate
entries: When you miss with an attack roll against a creature, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll you make against it before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Jealousy
entries: When a creature you have {@condition Grappled|XPHB} is about to make an ability check to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition on itself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll.

entries.name: Terror
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the Dash or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Doom Revisited
entries: Once per active Rage, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to channel a traumatic death. When you do, choose one of the following options.

entries.name: Contamination
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Poison damage and gain the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute.

To determine the Poison damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. An affected creature can use an action to end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on itself.

entries.name: Hypothermia
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Cold damage and have its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} halved for 1 minute.
To determine the Cold damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. A creature can use an action to end this effect on itself.

entries.name: Immolation
entries: At the start of their turn, each creature of your choice in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take Fire damage.

To determine the Fire damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Rage Damage bonus, and add them together. As an action, a creature can extinguish the fire on itself by giving itself the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and rolling on the ground. The fire also goes out if it is doused, submerged, or suffocated.

subclassFeature.name: Death Is but a Door
entries: Your familiarity with death has left you resistant to its call. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hard to Kill
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Death Saving Throws. In addition, you must fail four Death Saving Throws to die instead of three as normal.

entries.name: Return the Spirit
entries: You can call the spirits of the deceased to restore life essence to a nearby creature. You can cast the {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, Raise {@variantrule Dead|XPHB}, or {@spell Revivify|XPHB} spell without providing Material components. When you do, you gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level for Cure Wounds, 2 Exhuastion levels for Revivify, and 3 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels for Raise {@variantrule Dead|XPHB}. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this feature.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend two uses of your Rage (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Powered by Pathos
entries: Your Rage is empowered by the overwhelming emotions of the unquiet dead. Your Final Night Catharsis feature grants an additional effect based on the chosen emotion.

entries.name: Hate
entries: While your Rage is active, your attacks with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Jealousy
entries: Whenever a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you while your Rage is active, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to summon spectral assailants to Grapple the creature. The creature makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failure, the creature has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition until the end of its turn. On a successful save, the creature is not {@condition Grappled|XPHB}; however, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot for that creature until the end of its turn.

entries.name: Terror
entries: Whenever a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you while your Rage is active, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make that creature terrified until the start of its next turn. A terrified creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: College of Adventurers
entries: {@i Be a Master of Classes}

Bards from the College of Adventurers learn from heroes of old and stories of legend. Bards are jacks of all trades, and, for the College of Adventurers, this statement rings even truer. They combine all the skills of their companions into one, allowing them to be versatile and supportive. While not having a direct goal, many adventurer-studying Bards live to tell tales of other heroes or seek to create their own. Stories of great deeds, of desperate cunning, of magical anomalies, or of godly might fuel these Bards.

subclassFeature.name: Talented Adventurer
entries: You learn an adventurer's talent of your choice from the {@filter "Adventurer's Talent Options"|optionalfeatures|feature type=ca:at} section later in this subclass's description. You learn an additional adventurer's talent of your choice when you reach Bard levels 6 and 14.

subclassFeature.name: Party Planner
entries: While a creature has a Bardic Inspiration die from you, it can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to take the {@action Help|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Well-Rounded
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice, and you know one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Improvisational Talent
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can choose one adventurer's talent you know and replace it with one you don't.

subclassFeature.name: College of Fools
entries: {@i Laugh at Your Foes' Terror}

It's commonly believed the College of Fools is merely a front for a cult of Beleth. Bards in the College would say their relationship with the Arch Daemon of Fear is much more complicated. These Bards choose to laugh at Etharis's many horrors rather than be dismayed by them—a whimsical, if ghoulish, philosophy. Their delight in other creatures' terror encourages their obscene antics and cruel jests. One person's trick is another person's terror, after all.

subclassFeature.name: Antagonistic Antics
