items: It counts as a Simple weapon with which you are proficient.
It has the Light, Finesse, and Reach properties.
You can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls with this weapon.
Its damage die is the same as the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} expended to cast the spell, and the damage dealt is Necrotic.
Each time a creature takes damage from this weapon, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you cast this spell using a level 3-4 spell slot, you can make two weapon attacks with this weapon when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action. If you use a level 5+ spell slot, you can make three weapon attacks with this weapon when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action.

spell.name: Crown of Radiance
entries: A flaming crown of holy light adorns your head until the spell ends. A Fiend, Fey, or Undead that moves within 30 feet of you or begins its turn within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage.
The crown sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet.

spell.name: Dark Sacrament

m.text: a dagger encrusted in jewels worth 100+ GP

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend four {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet using the Material component of this spell. On a hit, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell plus {@dice 4d8}. You deal Necrotic damage equal to the roll's total. If this damage causes the creature to be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it immediately dies and you gain one of the following dark blessings of your choice. When you take Radiant damage while you have a dark blessing, you take an extra {@damage 1d4} Radiant damage.

entries.name: Unassailable
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all saving throws.

entries.name: Unbreakable
entries: Your size increases by one category (from Medium to Large, for example), you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) at the start of each of your turns, and your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage.

entries.name: Unerring
entries: Your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} increases by 2. Your dark blessing ends after 10 minutes or when you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, whichever happens first.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Dazing Blast
entries: A wave of force leaves your palms, targeting a creature within range. The target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} Force damage and has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes the damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: One additional creature can be targeted for each spell slot above 2.

spell.name: Earth Worm
entries: You transform the earth into a wormlike maw at an unoccupied point on the ground within range. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the worm. On a hit, the target takes Piercing damage equal to {@dice 3d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, it has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes {@damage 6d6} Bludgeoning damage at the start of each of your turns.

A creature trapped within the worm can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is regurgitated and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the worm.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the worm up to 30 feet.

spell.name: Elemental Exhalation
entries: When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects that determine the spell's damage type:

items.name: Air
entries: The damage type is Thunder. Each creature that fails the saving throw is pushed 10 feet away from you.

items.name: Coldfire
entries: The damage type is Cold. Each creature that fails the saving throw has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Earth
entries: The damage type is Bludgeoning. Each creature that fails the saving throw has its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Fire
entries: The damage type is Fire. Each creature that fails the saving throw is engulfed in flames and takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage at the end of its next turn. As an action, it can extinguish fire on itself by giving itself the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and rolling on the ground. The fire also goes out if it is doused, submerged, or suffocated.

items.name: Water
entries: The damage type is Acid. Each creature that fails the saving throw has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

Each creature within a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} of destructive elemental energy must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 5d6} damage of the chosen type. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Emmeline's Essence Infusion

m.text: a diamond vial containing at least one ounce of blood worth at least 100 GP, which this spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, you target one nonmagical weapon within range. That weapon becomes magical and gains a special benefit based on the creature type of the blood used as the Material component for this spell. The item requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, and only the creature attuned to this weapon gains these benefits.

entries.name: Aberration
entries: Your attacks with weapons deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage on a hit. In addition, you can telepathically speak with any creature that has taken at least 1 point of damage from this weapon in the last 24 hours, provided you are both on the same plane.

entries.name: Celestial
entries: Your attacks with weapons deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage on a hit. In addition, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause the weapon to shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet. You can end this effect by using another {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Dragon
entries: Your attack rolls with this weapon can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. In addition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your attacks with weapons deal an extra {@damage 1d4} Force damage on a hit. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature within 30 feet with this weapon, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: Your attacks with weapons deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage on a hit. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to change this extra damage to Cold or Fire.

When you cast this spell, you attune to the magic weapon. The spell's duration lasts as long as you have {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the weapon. During the spell's duration, the magic item is susceptible to the {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} spell. If you maintain {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the magic weapon for 1 year, the enchantment becomes permanent and this spell ends.

spell.name: Enspelled Armament

components.m: a vial of oil and water

entries: When you cast this spell, choose one Simple or Martial weapon. A replica of the chosen weapon, made of iridescent energy, appears in your hands. For the duration, you are proficient with that weapon and whenever you attack with the weapon, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. Attacks made with this weapon don't require ammunition, and if you throw the weapon as part of a ranged attack, it returns to your hand immediately after resolving the attack. The damage dealt by this weapon is Force instead of the weapon's normal damage type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage of the weapon increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 2. If you cast the spell using a level 5+ spell slot, the duration becomes 8 hours.

spell.name: Extract Iron
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} and extract a number of pounds of iron from your blood equal to the roll's total.

You fashion this iron into nonmagical metal objects. The combined weight of these objects must be equal to or less than the number rolled on the expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. The quality of these created objects is poor but functional.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend an additional {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} and create additional iron for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Fiend Flesh
entries: You touch a willing creature, transforming its skin into red scales. Until the spell ends, the target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold, Fire, and Lightning damage, and the target also has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage.

spell.name: Flash Fever
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The creature breaks into a cold sweat and makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the cold sweat becomes a burning fever and the creature takes {@damage 4d6} Fire damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

For the duration, at the start of the target's turn, it takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage. The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends. If the target fails three of the saves, it takes {@damage 8d6} Fire damage and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Flense
entries: You target a creature you can see within range, using necromantic force to slice the skin from its body. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to force the same target to make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 8d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The spell ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range, if the target is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or if you can't see it.

spell.name: Fleshcrawl
entries: You rip the flesh from a creature, fashioning it into a twisted monstrosity of blood and skin that rises up to attack the creature.

A creature that you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 8d10} Necrotic damage. The creature's flayed skin is animated as a grotesque mockery. It uses the {@creature Fleshling Construct|GrimHollowPG24} stat block. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger. The fleshling disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Frightful Start
entries: You twist your visage to scare a creature that you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Ghost Light
entries: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension and specify any number of creatures you can see within 10 feet. Until the spell ends, the object sheds silvery {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 20-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 20 feet. This light is only visible to the creatures you specified during the casting of the spell; all other creatures perceive the area affected by the light as they regularly would.

spell.name: Greater Animate Dead

m.text: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, a pinch of bone dust, and a black onyx stone worth 75+ GP for each level of CR you animate

entries: Choose a number of corpses, within range. You can reanimate up to 5 {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} 2 or lower Undead creatures from these corpses.

On each of your turns, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which time it stops obeying any command you've given it.

To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell rather than animating a new creature. Additionally, casting this spell in this manner doesn't require spell components with a GP cost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can animate one additional Undead creature for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Heartseeker

m.text: a ruby worth 100+ GP

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend six {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Blood flows from your body then crystallizes into a barbed arrow, which launches at a creature. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell, and the creature takes Piercing damage equal to the numbered rolled.

Once lodged in the creature, the bloody arrow begins to burrow toward its heart, rendering it susceptible to injury. Until the spell ends, the first successful attack against a creature after its turn ends each round is automatically a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

The target makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, the effect continues. On a success save, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} Necrotic damage and the spell ends.

spell.name: Holy Word
entries: You whisper a divine word under your breath, careful not to speak loudly, for such celestial power isn't for the unworthy. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage. If the target is Fey, Fiend, or Undead, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet and it can't take Reactions until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Hunter Sense
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's senses are heightened. Whenever the target makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check, it can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

spell.name: Illusory Instrument
entries: You create an illusionary copy of a mundane {@item musical instrument|XPHB}. The copy of the instrument takes on the shape of your fondest memory of the instrument, such as the first {@item flute|XPHB} you owned or the half harp gifted to you by a loved one. This illusion moves as its physical counterpart would, but it is weightless and is tangible only to you. This instrument can be used as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}. This illusory instrument dissipates if you move 10 feet away from it orchoose to end the spell (no action required by you).
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command your instrument to create one of the following effects:

items: Mimic basic sounds heard on a daily basis, such as a bird chirping, footsteps, or a slamming door.
Automatically play a basic beat at the tempo of your choice.
Record anything played on it, and play it back on a loop.
Record and playback any noise that it could pick up within 15 feet, such as conversation, a royal decree, or a snoring party member who swears that they don't snore.

spell.name: Incite Riot
entries: When you cast this spell, you wave the red handkerchief used as the Material component and choose any number of creatures within range that can see you. Each chosen creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} creature is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your allies. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, it must use its action to make melee attacks against the nearest creature (other than you or your allies) or use its turn to move toward the nearest target.
At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

spell.name: Intaglio

components.m: a quill or a vial of ink

entries: You create a duplicate of a text or image. During the spell's duration, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to trace your hand over any non-magical text or image on a surface within range. You copy the text or image onto a new medium that you provide, such as another book or parchement. This spell copies a single page with each {@action Magic|XPHB} action. When copying a spellbook, you can do so using the same method as you would replace a spellbook, except the time and GP requirements are both halved.

spell.name: Investiture of Venom
entries: Until the spell ends, your veins bulge and become visibly green beneath your skin, your eyes weep constantly with liquid poison, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

You can determine if creatures you can see within 30 feet of you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature makes a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature loses {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage, {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage, or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, a {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} of venom 15 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

spell.name: Lifesink
entries: An aura extends from you in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} for the duration. Any other creature that enters or begins its turn in the area takes {@damage 4d6} Necrotic damage. At the start of your turn, you regain {@dice 4d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} plus 1 for each creature in the area.

spell.name: Life Tether
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a sickly green tether forms between you and your target. Whenever you take damage, the tethered target takes half as much damage (round down) as Necrotic damage. If the target drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} before this spell ends, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to move the tether to a new creature you can see within range. The new target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be tethered.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can create additional tethers with a spell slot of level 4 (two tethers), 6 (three tethers), or 8 (four tethers).

spell.name: Little Death

m.text: an item of personal sentimental value worth 1+ SP

entries: When you cast this spell, you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and die. At the start of your next turn, you become a {@creature Ghost|XMM} occupying the same space as your corpse. Your game statistics are replaced by the {@creature Ghost|XMM|Ghost's} stat block, but you retain your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}; {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and languages.

While you are a {@creature Ghost|XMM}, you can only use abilities detailed in the {@creature Ghost|XMM|Ghost's} stat block. In addition, you add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to your attack rolls and the DC of your {@creature Ghost|XMM} abilities.

Your GM secretly rolls {@dice 1d8} when you cast the spell. After a number of hours equal to the number rolled, the spell ends. The spell ends early if you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as a {@creature Ghost|XMM} or you take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to end the spell. If the Material component used to cast this spell remains on your corpse, you return to life with a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. If the Material component used to cast this spell is no longer on your corpse, you die.

If your body is destroyed or damaged beyond the capacity to survive while you are under the effects of this spell, its duration becomes permanent. You are now a {@creature Ghost|XMM} until your body is targeted by an effect that returns the living to the dead such as {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB} or {@spell Resurrection|XPHB}.

spell.name: Maelfa's Quickened Class
entries: When you cast this spell, you give an abbreviated lecture on a topic of your choosing to 10 willing creatures of your choice within range. When you do so, choose one spell you know or have prepared, one skill you are proficient in, or one language you can speak, read, and write. Each chosen creature is temporarily imparted with a portion of your knowledge.

If you chose a spell, each creature prepares the spell, the spell is considered on the creature's spell list, and it doesn't count against the creature's number of prepared spells. If you chose a skill, each targeted creature gains proficiency in that skill. If you chose a language, each targeted creature can speak, read, and write that language.

The creature loses the knowledge of the spell, proficiency, or language when this spell ends. If a creature is targeted by this spell while under the effect of a previous casting of the spell, the previous casting immediately ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The duration of the spell increases with a spell slot level of 3 or 4 (30 days), 5 or 6 (10 days), 7 or 8 (30 days), or 9 (1 year).

spell.name: Magic Mirror

time.condition: which you take when you are targeted by a spell

entries: A momentary bubble of iridescent energy shimmers in the air between you and a foe. The triggering spell is redirected to a creature of your choice you can see within 60 feet. If the spell is level 5 or lower, you are no longer a target of the spell and the chosen creature is instead. If the spell is level 6 or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus the spell's level). On a successful check, you are no longer a target of the spell and the chosen creature is instead. On a failed check, you remain the target of the triggering spell.

spell.name: Melting Curse
entries: You target a creature and a metal object held or worn by that creature you can see within range. The creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d8} Fire damage and the targeted object melts and oozes to the ground, where it returns to its normal shape and temperature. If the object is magical, the creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw.

If the creature tries to retrieve or otherwise touch the object for the duration, the object heats and melts, and the creature takes {@damage 5d8} Fire damage. The object returns to normal once the creature is no longer touching it or the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Mirror Spell

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

entries: You attempt to copy and cast a spell of level 3 or lower that you can see being cast. You can only copy spells cast by creatures, and you can't copy your own spell.

If the triggering spell is level 2 or lower, you automatically copy and cast the spell. If the spell is level 3 or higher, you must succeed on an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus the triggering spell's level) to copy and cast the spell.

When casting a copied spell, you don't expend a spell slot and you don't need any components. Treat the spell as if you were its original caster, using your own spellcasting ability modifier and save DC, and casting it at the lowest level it can be cast.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Treat the level of the spell slot used as the maximum level of spell you can copy and cast.

spell.name: Mortality

m.text: the skull of a humanoid encrusted in gems worth 200+ GP

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend five {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended, then choose an Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, or Fiend within range and condemn it to a taste of mortality. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum and current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are reduced by the amount rolled on the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell.

For the duration of the spell, a creature that fails the saving throw loses all damage Immunities and Resistances, its creature type changes to Humanoid, and it takes an additional {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage each time it takes damage.

If a creature affected by this spell is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, these changes become permanent and the creature dies. This final effect of the spell can only be reversed if the creature is restored to life and targeted by a Remove {@variantrule Curses|XPHB|Curse} spell or similar magic.

spell.name: Neutralize Aura
entries: You touch a willing creature and neutralize its aura. Until the spell ends, the target can't be perceived by Fey, Fiends, Celestials, and Undead.
The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, casts a spell, or moves within 5 feet of one of the creature types.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Overgrow
entries: When you cast this spell, choose a creature or an object within range that is Huge or smaller and not being worn or carried within range. Vibrant vines quickly grow around the target, pinning it into place and making it easier to traverse.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition on a success.

If the target is an object, it can't be moved from its current location and creatures that climb the object don't spend extra movement. A creature can make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC to wrest the object out of the vines so it can be moved. If the object is too heavy for the creature to move, this action fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can choose an additional target for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Perfection
entries: You speak a holy word and remake a creature you can see in the image of the Arch Seraphs. The {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on the creature ends, curses on the target are suppressed for the spell's duration, and it is restored to its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. The creature's ability scores less than 18 become 18. Depending on the word you use, you also bless the target based upon the Arch Seraph that you call upon:

entries.name: Aphaelon:
entries: The target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition. If the target fails a saving throw, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause the save to be rerolled. It must use the new roll.

entries.name: Empyreus:
entries: The target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, and the target deals an extra {@damage 4d6} Force damage to the first target it hits on each of its turns.

entries.name: Miklas:
entries: The target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, and it regains {@dice 4d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Morael:
entries: The target gains 30 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. When an ally within 60 feet of the target takes damage, the target can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to take the damage instead.

entries.name: Solyma:
entries: The target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Thunder damage. When the target takes damage from a creature it can see, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deal Fire damage to that creature equal to the triggering damage.

entries.name: Zabriel:
entries: The target gains {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. At the end of each of its turn, the target can award {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to an ally that doesn't have it.

spell.name: Phoenix Flames
entries: You immolate yourself, consuming your body in a searing cloud of holy flames. You are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and die, and burning radiance erupts from you in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 30d6} Radiant damage and gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it and everything nonmagical it is wearing and carrying are incinerated. The target can be revived only by a True Resurrection or a Wish spell.
After 10 minutes, you rise from the ashes where you originally cast the spell. You return to life as if you were targeted by a True Resurrection spell.

spell.name: Power Word Maim
entries: You command the body of a creature to twist and warp. If the target has 125 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fewer, it takes {@damage 8d10} Necrotic damage, and it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. Otherwise, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the start of your next turn. The target makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

spell.name: Preserve

components.m: a sack containing a pinch of salt

entries: Food and other perishable items weighing 5 pounds or less that you place in a sack don't age or decay for the duration.

spell.name: Primordial Power
entries: When you cast this spell, grant a creature in range a portion of the power of the elementals. For the duration, the creature can speak and understand Primordial and gains additional benefits based on the element you choose when you cast the spell:

items.name: Air
entries: The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Lightning and Thunder damage. In addition, it has a Fly speed of 30 feet.

items.name: Coldfire
entries: The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage. In addition, it can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to expend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die}, regaining a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the numbered rolled plus its Constitution modifier. When the target takes Fire damage, it can't use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its next turn.

items.name: Earth
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against being moved or knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}. In addition, it has {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet.

items.name: Fire
entries: The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage. In addition, when the target takes damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of it, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one melee attack against that creature, using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

items.name: Water
entries: The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid damage. In addition, it can breathe underwater and has a Swim speed of 60 feet.

spell.name: Reanimate

m.text: a mlange of wilted daisies and other herbal powders worth 300+ GP, which this spell consumes

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. You touch a creature that has died within the last 10 minutes and return it to life with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. In addition, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell, and the creature gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll.

At the start of each of the target's turns, it loses 1 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB|Temporary Hit Point} granted by this spell. While the creature has {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this spell, it moves with unnatural vigor, gaining a +2 bonus to {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}. Once it loses the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this spell, the creature gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.
This spell can't revive a creature that has died of old age, nor does it restore any missing body parts.

spell.name: Red Rain
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend eight {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Over the course of {@dice 1d6} times 5 minutes, the sky darkens and thick droplets of blood rain everywhere within 5 miles of you.

Each Beast and Plant creature in the area must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until it has spent 1 minute outside the area. Mundane plants exposed to the rain wither and die after 10 minutes.

For every 10 minutes that a creature of any type is directly exposed to the rain, that creature gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level and takes {@damage 2d10} Necrotic damage. The creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. This reduction lasts until the creature removes all levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} gained from this spell. While a creature has any {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels from this spell, it automatically fails saving throws against removing the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

When the spell ends, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. Beast and Plant creatures won't return and plants won't regrow in the area for a number of days equal to the roll's total.

spell.name: Ride the Lightning
entries: You transform yourself into a bolt of lightning, creating a 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} between your current space and an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you. Each creature in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. You then reappear in the chosen space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 4. In addition, the maximum length of the line increases 10 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Sanguine Fusillade

components.m: a needle dipped in your blood

entries: You crystalize your foe's blood into razor darts that burst forth to strike your enemies. As part of casting this spell, you must expend seven {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target takes Piercing damage equal to the roll. When a creature takes this damage, seven crimson darts burst from it.

You can direct each dart to hit a creature within 60 feet of the original target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several, including the original target. For each dart, make a ranged spell attack against the chosen creature. On a hit, roll one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} expended to cast the spell, and the creature takes Piercing damage equal to the number rolled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend an additional {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} and create another dart for each spell slot level above 7.

spell.name: Sanguine Poppet

m.text: an object shaped like a creature worth 1+ CP

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend three {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. You smear the spell's Material component with your blood. The object shudders and becomes a poppet under your control.

The poppet's AC equals 10 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and your spellcasting ability modifier, and it has 30 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. If your poppet is ever reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or it is more than 1 mile away, the spell ends immediately. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command your poppet to move 30 feet, and you can see and hear through it until the start of your next turn.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cause the poppet to detonate in an explosion of blood, ending this spell. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast this spell. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on the poppet makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking Necrotic damage equal to the roll on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can expend an additional {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} for each spell slot level above 3. Additionally, the duration of this spell increases by 1 hour for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Sanguine Shield
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. You draw lifeforce from those injured around you to create a swirling shield of blood. You gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each creature within 30 feet of you that is below its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum (including you) to a maximum of 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. While you have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from this spell, you have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover}. When the spell ends, all {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from it are lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The maximum number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you gain increases by 5 for each two spell slot levels above 2.

spell.name: Seal Spellcasting

components.m: wax mixed with lead and a stamp

entries: When you cast this spell, choose a creature you can see within range. When the target casts a spell, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature expends a spell slot to cast the spell as normal but the spell has no effect. On a successful save, the creature casts the spell but takes {@damage 3d8} Force damage. After the creature makes a saving throw, the spell immediately ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot above level 2.

spell.name: Sense Lifeblood
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. The lifeblood flowing within creatures tells you its secrets. Creatures that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition are immune to this spell. Until the spell ends, you can determine if creatures you can see are related biologically. In addition, you know if a creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are at maximum, below maximum, at half, or below half.

Once on each of your turns when you hit a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature with an attack roll using a weapon, {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, or spell, you can cause the target to take extra Necrotic. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Your {@status Concentration|XPHB} can last longer with a spell slot of level 3-4 (up to 1 hour) or 5+ (up to 8 hours).

spell.name: Serpent Tongue
entries: You transform your tongue into a poisonous serpent for the duration. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} Piercing damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for every spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Shared Judgement
entries: Once on each of your turns when you reduce an Undead to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can deal {@damage 5d6} Radiant damage to a creature you can see within 60 feet of you no action required.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Shroud Blood
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} or the spell automatically fails.  You can choose yourself or a willing creature within 30 feet of yourself to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks. When the target loses the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition for a number of rounds equal to the number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. The target loses the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition immediately after it makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target an additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Somnolence

components.m: sand mixed with the spellcaster's blood

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} expended to cast the spell plus {@dice 2d12} and choose a creature within range. If the roll's total is equal to or greater than the chosen creature's current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the creature falls into a magical slumber for 1 minute. If the roll's total is equal to or greater than the chosen creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum, the magical slumber lasts for 24 hours instead. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell's effect. A creature woken early from this spell gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.
Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, or that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.

entries.name: The Long Sleep
entries: Adherents of the Prismatic Circle perform a variation of the Somnolence spell that takes 10 minutes and requires the sacrifice of a Humanoid. These adherents believe when the ritual is completed, it staves off the waking of Gormadraug for a day and night. Through the repetitive performance of this ritual, the Druids of the Prismatic Circle hope to ensure Gormadraug slumbers forever.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You roll an additional {@dice 1d12} and can expend an additional two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} for every spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Spirit Swarm
entries: You invite spirits to take their revenge upon a target. A creature you can see within range must make a Charisma saving throw. The target must have a Charisma of 3 or higher. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d8} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

spell.name: Splattering Smite

time.note: which you take when you hit a creature with a Melee weapon

entries: Your strikes drink the splattered blood of your foes. As part of casting this spell, you must expend five {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} or the spell automatically fails. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the numbered rolled.

spell.name: Steal Immortality

time.condition: which you take when a Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within range that you can see is reduced to 0 Hit Points

m.text: the skull of a humanoid encrusted in gems worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend nine {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell and gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice the roll's total. You gain the creature type of the spell's target, in addition to your own type.

While the spell lasts, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition; you no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe; you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; and you gain a benefit based on your new creature type:

entries.name: Celestial
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant and Necrotic damage and have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Elemental
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, and Thunder damage.

entries.name: Fey
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn, or teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold and Fire damage and have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Undead
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, and you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.
You have the creature type and benefits until you cast the spell again, or you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

spell.name: Suffocate
entries: You create a pair of grasping hands made from {@condition invisible} force. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the creature has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. While it has this condition, it can't breathe.

A creature can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to 1 plus its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds) before suffocation begins. When a creature runs out of breath, it gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level at the end of each of its turns. When a creature can breathe again, it removes all levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} it gained from suffocating.

A creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by the hands can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.

spell.name: Summon Plant

m.text: a ceramic pot filled with herbs and fertilizer worth at least 200 GP

entries: You call forth a plant spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Plant Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a floral feature: Blooming, Oaken, or Thorny. The creature resembles an animated plant marked by the chosen floral feature, which determines one of the traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Summon Sea Spirit

m.text: a bejeweled statuette of a sea serpent worth at least 300 GP

entries: You call forth an abyssal spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Sea Serpent stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an abhorrent feature: Enormous Mouth, Glowing Lantern, or Scaled Wings. The creature resembles a monstrous sea creature marked by the chosen abhorrent feature, which determines one of the traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Supernal Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: Your strike cause ambient magic surrounded a creature to collapse and detonate. The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 4d6} Force damage from the attack. If the creature is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell, that {@status Concentration|XPHB} is broken.

In addition, each ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

spell.name: Theft of Vitae

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage

entries: Roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell. The triggering creature takes Necrotic damage equal to the result. You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the result plus the triggering damage, to a maximum of 15 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The maximum number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} you can gain from casting increases by 10 for each slot level above 2.

spell.name: Thorn Armor
entries: When you cast this spell, a flexible exoskeleton covered in thorns appears around a willing target within range. The target gains {@dice 3d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. If a creature hits the target with a melee attack roll before the spell ends, that creature takes Piercing damage equal to the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} lost as a result of the attack. This spell ends early if the target has no remaining {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The target gains an additional {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Tremor
entries: The ground around you in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} begins to shake violently. You are unaffected by the tremors. The ground is considered {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} and whenever the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} enters a creature's space, a creature enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, or the creature ends its turn there, the creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} Bludgeoning damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Undead Enthrallment

components.m: a clay pot filled with brackish water, another clay pot filled with grave dirt, and a black onyx stone worth 500 + GP for each corpse

entries: Choose a corpse, or a number or corpses, within range that are equivalent to the size of the creature you are animating (the GM determines how many corpses are required). Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an Undead creature. You can choose for the target to become an Undead creature of CR 3 or lower (the GM has the creature's game statistics).

On each of your turns, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you. (If you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one.) You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over 1 creature you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one. Any creature you have maintained with this spell for 30 days remains permanently under your control. You may only control a maximum of four creatures with this spell.

spell.name: Vampiric Claws
entries: You sprout wicked claws. When you use your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} to deal damage with the new growth, it deals {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage instead of dealing the normal damage for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, and you use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

While the spell lasts, each time you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} from the spell are lost when the spell ends.

spell.name: Vibrating Humors
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend one Hit Die or the spell automatically fails. A creature you can see within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes Thunder damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks from its blood vibrating loudly. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} expended to cast this spell.
The target repeats the save at the end of each of turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You increase the damage by expending an additional Hit Die for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Viscous Sheath
entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend seven {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} or the spell automatically fails. Your body is wrapped in clotted blood. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack roll, the attacker takes Necrotic damage. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

If a creature hits you with a Melee weapon, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have clots form around the weapon, entrapping it. The attacker must succeed on a Strength saving throw or the weapon sticks to you. If the attacker doesn't release the weapon, the creature has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon can't be used. The target can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC, freeing the weapon on a success. The creature can also release the weapon to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition.
You can trap a number of weapons equal to the number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} expended to cast the spell. When the spell ends, the weapons are released.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can trap an additional weapon for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Wall of Gloom
entries: You create a wall of swirling gray energy, formed of the psychic pain of loss. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a ringed wall that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight.

The wall sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} out to a range of 100 feet. When you cast the spell, you and creatures you designate can pass through and remain near the wall without harm. If a creature moves within 20 feet of it or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

A creature can move through the wall, though the attempt is emotionally draining. The first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

spell.name: Weave Numen

m.text: a mithral sewing needle worth 300 GP+, which the spell consumes

entries: You can sense the presence of magic within 120 feet of yourself. You see a faint aura around any visible creature or object within that range that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.
In addition, you gain thirteen threads. You can spend these threads to gain benefits as described below, with no action required unless stated:

items: When you cast a spell, you can expend 1 thread to enhance the spell as if you had expended a spell slot 1 level higher than you did and you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 1 plus the level of the spell.

When a creature you can see within 120 feet of you casts a spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend 1 thread to interrupt that spell. If it's a spell of level 3 or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If it's a spell of level 4 or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC equals 10 plus the spell's level). On a successful check, the spell fails and has no effect.

When you cast a spell that causes a creature to be healed or take damage, you can spend up to six threads. The amount of damage or healing caused to one creature by that spell increases by four times the number of expended threads.

entries: You lose all remaining threads when this spell ends. If you spend all threads granted by the spell, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You gain an additional two threads per spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Wilting Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: As part of casting this spell, you must expend two {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} or the spell automatically fails. The creature loses all Resistances to damage until the start of your next turn. The target hit by the strike takes extra Necrotic damage from the attack. To determine this damage, roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} expended to cast the spell.

spell.name: Wipe Face
entries: You curse a creature that you can see within range. The target's face is replaced with completely smooth skin, sealing the creature's eyes, nose, and mouth. The creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions and begins suffocating.

At the end of each of its turns, the target can attempt a Constitution saving throw to end the spell. Dealing at least 15 Slashing damage to the target opens an airway allowing it to breathe, but  the curse seals the opening at the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with excruciating muscle spasms for the duration. On a failed save, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

spell.name: Curse of Conceited Obsession

m.text: a thread from the bed or clothes of your target, a handful of teeth, and a gilded mirror worth 1,000+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with an obsessive self-infatuation. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. Successful {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} Psychic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. Additionally, for 1 minute, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d10} Psychic damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the cursed creature looks into a mirror or reflective surface, the surface cracks or become distorted in some way, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature is compelled to stop and admire itself whenever it sees its reflection. It constantly fusses over its appearance.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes obsessed with looking for its reflection wherever it goes, including in the eyes of its foes. Attacks against the cursed creature have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature is driven to find or build a location where it can see its own reflection from many angles. The cursed creature is compelled to remain in this location and admire itself. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls from its obsession with its own appearance.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Weeping Willow.

spell.name: Curse of Crushing Sensation

m.text: a drop of the target's blood, a shred of silk material, and a horn worth 1,000+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with painful hypersensitivity to physical sensations. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} Thunder damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. For 1 minute, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Thunder damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d10} Thunder damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target hears a loud noise, it gets a crippling headache, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature avoids {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}, loud noises, extreme temperatures, and doesn't like to be touched.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature can't stand the feeling of rough or heavy clothing against its skin. It can't wear armor. It has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Thunder damage from its hypersensitivity. Additionally, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls if it or its target is in an area of {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: Even mild sensory input becomes intolerable to the cursed creature. It is driven to find a dark and quiet lair, such as a deep cave or dungeon. The cursed creature can't willingly leave this lair and has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to all damage except for Psychic damage while outside its lair.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Sightless Agony.

spell.name: Curse of Damned Aging

m.text: a childhood possession of the target, a pint of blood, and a watch worth 600+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with horrific aging. The target must make a Strength saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 2d10} Necrotic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. For 1 minute, the target has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (you choose when you cast the spell).

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} Necrotic damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it finds multiple wrinkles, grey hairs, or spots it didn't previously have, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature is compelled to rest when the occasion permits it, becoming lethargic and lazy.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes feeble. After finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, the creature can only use 25 percent of its {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, rounded up, to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature starts to age rapidly, becoming decrepit. The cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Body Snatcher.

spell.name: Curse of Fastidious Pride

m.text: a shred of the target's clothing, an uncrushed dead spider, and a sewing needle worth 600+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with narcissistic hubris.

The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. Successful {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Psychic damage, has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target hears its name spoken, the speaker sounds derisive regardless of its actual tone, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature hears veiled insults everywhere, believing everyone is jealous of its brilliance and talent.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature feels restless unless it is actively working to accomplish a goal. The cursed creature gains no benefit from its Short Rests.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature believes everyone is involved in a conspiracy to bring about its downfall. Whenever it fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Mind Siphon.

spell.name: Curse of Foul Blight

m.text: a shred of the target's hair or flesh, a chunk of rotten meat, and a jewelry box worth 600+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with a putrefying and stinking pox. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. Successful {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 3d10} Necrotic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. Additionally, it can't gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} or regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} Necrotic damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target searches for its garments or equipment, it finds an infestation of insects, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature is afflicted with a minor cough. Whenever it speaks more than a few words at a time, it breaks into a fit of coughing. This does not affect spellcasting.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The smell of putrescence lingers in the air around the cursed creature. Food and drink quickly spoil, jewelry tarnishes, and wood rots within 10 feet of the cursed creature. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Charisma ability checks and saving throws, and it can't maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature's skin becomes riddled with pockmarks, pustules, and lesions. Insects flock to the cursed creature, infesting its clothes. The cursed creature can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} except by spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} after finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Plague Carrion.

spell.name: Curse of Ill-Fated Fortune

m.text: a discarded piece of the target's equipment, a splinter of bone, and a collection of dice worth 800+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with lethal bad luck. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 3d10} Thunder damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. Additionally,  the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the first {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes in the next 1 minute.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 7d10} Thunder damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target walks through a doorway, the target stubs its toe or bashes its head, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature falls victim to minor inconveniences and bad luck. Shops it wishes to visit close just as it arrives, and its equipment breaks at inconvenient moments.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes a beacon of bad luck as otherwise harmless setbacks become increasingly dangerous. Objects constantly seem to be placed in the creature's way. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ability checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature becomes dangerously prone to accidents, as even the simplest tasks have unforeseen life-threatening consequences. The cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} checks, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 10 feet, and it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it misses an attack roll.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Herald of Calamity.

spell.name: Curse of Insatiable Greed

m.text: a coin that the target has previously possessed, the tail of a rat, and a golden crown of thorns worth 800+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with a bitter and self-destructive greed. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. Successful {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}. On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Cold damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} Cold damage, and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. At the end of each turns, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 5 feet, until it reaches its maximum {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target finishes a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it notices it has lost a valued item, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature becomes compelled to steal trinkets.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature finds a secret place to start stashing its stolen trinkets, and it becomes anxious about leaving the location for extended periods of time. The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature is driven to transform its hoard of trinkets into a labyrinth of possessions and treasure. The cursed creature desires to remain in this lair. The creature can't take Reactions.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Verminous Abomination.

spell.name: Curse of Lost Sentiment

m.text: a lock of hair from someone the target loves, an animal's heart, and an idol worth 600+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with the loss of memories and horrific madness. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 3d10} Force damage, has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, and is unaware it was targeted by a curse.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} Force damage, has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the target finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it suffers nightmarish visions of being abandoned or left alone, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature begins forgetting events that have occurred within the past few days and the names of acquaintances.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature forgets all but its closest companions, and it has delusions of hidden threats and scheming rivals. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature forgets its closest companions, its own identity, and its goals. The curse fabricates delusions of a great conspiracy that only the cursed creature can prevent. The cursed creature is compelled to take any action it believes necessary to uncover this conspiracy. The creature can't take Bonus Actions.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Dream Whisperer.

spell.name: Curse of Ravenous Hunger

m.text: a morsel of food that belonged to the target, a sun-dried slug, and a dining plate worth 400+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with painful and unending starvation. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 2d10} Poison damage, has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn, and is aware it was targeted by a curse.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Poison damage, has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time it eats a meal, the cursed creature bites its tongue and its mouth fills with blood, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature is gripped with an insatiable appetite.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes compelled to eat inappropriate items such as coins, flowers, glass, and dirt. Additionally, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws, and its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to its character level (or Hit Dice if it has no character level).

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature becomes ravenous and is compelled to consume the flesh of Humanoids. No other food satiates it. The creature can't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes a Bloated Gastromorph.

spell.name: Curse of Uncontrollable Wrath

m.text: blood or other fluid of the target, a severed hand, and a serrated knife worth 1,000+ GP, all of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell curses a creature with an uncontrollable temper and a lust for violence. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw.

entries.name: Successful Saving Throw
entries: On a successful save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} Psychic damage and is aware it was targeted by a curse. Additionally, for 1 minute, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attacks made using Reactions.

entries.name: Initial Effect
entries: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d10} Psychic damage and is cursed.

entries.name: Triggering Event
entries: The next time the cursed creature attacks with a weapon or casts a spell using a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, an old wound reopens, and the curse advances to Stage 1.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: The cursed creature becomes easily agitated and aggressive.

entries.name: Stage 2
entries: The cursed creature becomes obsessed with violence. The thrill of solo battle intoxicates it, and its demeanor toward its allies sours as the curse grows. The cursed creature gains no benefit from its Short Rests.

entries.name: Stage 3
entries: The cursed creature is driven to insatiable bloodlust, unable to rest while there are enemies to slaughter. The cursed creature gains no benefit from its Long Rests.

entries.name: Culmination
entries: The cursed creature twists into a deformed figure and becomes an Avatar of Slaughter.
